subject: Re: assert keywork
msgSnippet: That s the solution! Thank you. Bye Alberto
messageBody:
That's the solution!
Thank you.

Bye
Alberto

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Benedict Heal" <bh@b...> wrote:
>
> You must enable assertions.
> Under window/preferences/java/installed JREs, edit the JRE, and set the
> vmargs to -ea
>
> Benedict
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: albamatiit [mailto:albamatiit@y...]
> > Sent: 08 November 2004 13:49
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] assert keywork
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > I use JUnit in Eclipse 3.0. When an assert (java keyword) fail, the
> > test go on instead of terminate with an error. How can I detect an
> > assert failure in tests?
> > Bye
